org.goobi.mq.processors

Class CreateNewProcessProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.goobi.mq.ActiveMQProcessor
      • org.goobi.mq.processors.CreateNewProcessProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.jms.MessageListener

    public class CreateNewProcessProcessor
extends ActiveMQProcessor
    CreateNewProcessProcessor is an Apache Active MQ consumer which registers to a queue configured by "activeMQ.createNewProcess.queue" on application startup. It was designed to create new processes from outside Goobi. There are two ways providing to create new processes. If the MapMessage on that queue contains of all the fields listed, the bibliographic data is retrieved using a catalogue configured within Goobi. If “opac” is missing, it will try to create a process just upon the data passed in the “userFields” − “field” and “value” will be ignored in that case, and the “docType” can be set manually.

    Field summary:

    String template
    name of the process template to use.
    String opac
    Cataloge to use for lookup.
    String field
    Field to look into, usually 12 (PPN).
    String value
    Value to look for, id of physical medium
    String docType
    DocType value to use if no catalogue request is performed.
    Set<String> collections
    Collections to be selected.
    Map<String, String> userFields collections
    Fields to be populated manually.
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>
